intro: Roccardia rosea subf. alba, commonly known as the white roccardia, is a rare and delicate plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a soft, ethereal appearance. It is native to specific regions in southern Europe and is often found in moist, calcareous soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
